thread.title: Alberta NDP’s ‘building a pipeline…to your heart’ Valentine receives mixed messages online | Globalnews.ca
thread.title_full: Alberta NDP’s ‘building a pipeline…to your heart’ Valentine receives mixed messages online | Globalnews.ca

author: Alyssa Julie
title: Alberta NDP’s ‘building a pipeline…to your heart’ Valentine receives mixed messages online | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 14, 2017 5:36 pm Alberta NDP’s ‘building a pipeline…to your heart’ Valentine receives mixed messages online By Alyssa Julie News Talk 770 
An Alberta NDP valentine with Premier Rachel Notley's photo on it is garnering mixed reaction Feb. 14, 2017. @AlbertaNDP Twitter What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - 
The Alberta NDP has stirred up controversy on Twitter with a Valentine’s Day message to Albertans. 
The valentine features a smiling Rachel Notley and reads: “building a pipeline … to your heart.” Happy Valentine's Day from all of us at the Alberta NDP. pic.twitter.com/PAY6B8MMxQ 
— Josh McLean (@RadioMcLean) February 14, 2017 @MetlSlyme @albertaNDP I'm not even mad. This is amazing. 
— Graham Mosimann (@GrahamMosimann) February 14, 2017 @albertaNDP Happy Valentine's Day! I'm so proud to be Albertan right now! You guys are knocking it out of the park! 💖👍🏾🎉🍾🏆 #naturalleadership 
— Paige (@paigerosner) February 14, 2017 
The Trudeau administration gave its seal of approval to the two pipelines in December 2016. The prime minister said it was Alberta’s climate leadership that opened the door to the pipeline approvals. 
But the province has experienced quite a bit of backlash over its climate policies, including the much-maligned carbon tax , which came into effect Jan. 1. 
Watch below: What will Alberta’s carbon tax cost you? Laurel Gregory takes a look. 
Several people on Twitter appeared frustrated, or even angered by the government’s playful message. @albertaNDP more like "piling a suffocating deficit on your future through our incompetent management" #ableg #FireNotley #ScrapTheNDP 
— Lisa (@MissCareless198) February 14, 2017 
Janet Brown, a political analyst from Calgary, told News Talk 770 she expects the greeting will simply reinforce Albertans’ opinions on the NDP. 
“If it was an attempt to change anyone’s mind or make them feel any better about the NDP , it was probably misguided,” Brown said. 
“If it was just a way to express something jovial to people who already support you, then it wasn’t a bad idea.” 
While several people responded with anger over the government’s policies, especially as the Alberta economy continues to struggle in the wake of low oil prices, others sought to shine a spotlight on the perceived environmental impact of the pipelines and the impact on First Nations communities. 
— Katie Jensen (@katiejensen) February 14, 2017 @albertaNDP Right through the hearts of First Nations people. Can you get any more tone deaf?!
